industry: Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage
description:
Introduction

Come move the world with us!

Wake up each day to be part of a  global movement .  A movement to  make an impact . A movement to  go for it!  A movement to  provide best-in class solutions . A movement to be  empowered . A movement to  do the right thing .

Make AIT Worldwide Logistics the next stop on your career journey!

See what our teammates say about working at AIT Worldwide Logistics .

Overview

The Warehouse Supervisor is responsible for supervising company strategy related to domestic, international, VAS and cartage freight warehouse operations through an understanding of industry trends and best practices. Work with international, domestic and cartage operations staff and internal AIT functions to provide the best overall warehouse service

Responsibilities

  • Support warehouse operations staff in the day-to-day activities of Domestic, International, Pick Pack and Ship, and Cartage Freight Warehouse and Department personnel.
  • Meet directly with local warehouse supplier/tools/equipment providers through all communication levels (email, phone, meeting, provider site visits). Utilize negotiation and communication skills to obtain desired results
  • Develop an AIT baseline of operations and benchmark to industry standards for AIT logistics areas such as warehousing for domestic, international, and “Pick Pack and Ship” helping to identify opportunities for cost and service improvement. Reach out to peers through attendance of seminars, industry events, education settings and corporate contact.
  • Supervise and oversee daily domestic service and operations activities as it relates to cartage, freight movement and dispatch pickup/delivery quotes
  • Provide an effective warehousing system that delivers a high level of service to both external and internal customers. Identify opportunities within the affected areas and partner with Terminal / Station Manager to implement new solutions through project management protocols and elimination of constraints.
  • Review and suggest changes to permanent and temporary staff as needed to ensure the warehouse department are able to meet company goals.
  • Achieve warehouse expense goals by working with various AIT internal groups to develop, implement and monitor warehousing logistic metrics.
  • Ensure safe working environment through consistent practice of safety programs and procedures
  • Other duties and responsibilities as the business deems necessary
  • The wage range for this position is $66,560.00 - $92,623.45 and may vary based on geography as well as relative knowledge, skills, abilities, and experience.

Qualifications

  • A team player who works well with others – being respectful to our teammates is a Core Value
  • A strong work ethic with an appreciation for ownership, independence, accountability, and autonomy in your role
  • Growth mindset – being passionate about your craft, always looking for ways to improve yourself and the company, being open to change and doing things differently
  • Customer service focus – we serve a wide variety of customers, both internal and external, and building relationships is a part of our culture

Other Skills We Hope to See:

  • High School diploma and/or GED required
  • Must be familiar with Warehouse (Pick, Pack and Ship), domestic, international and cartage freight forwarding warehousing services
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Outlook)
  • Proficiency in WMS – 3PL Central
  • Must possess clear written and verbal communications
  • Organize and write procedures in a logical/methodical manner
  • Good time management skills
  • Excellent attention to detail
  • Ability to maintain confidential information
  • Maintain satisfactory attendance
  • Adhere to company policies, programs, and work rules
  • Perform work in a timely manner
  • Highly motivated, self-directed, and results driven
  • Detail oriented with strong organizational skills
  • Able to take direction and follow through multi-step project steps/procedures consistently
  • Proven track record of successfully managing multiple priorities in a fast paced work environment

What AIT Can Offer You

In addition to your base compensation, you may be eligible for a bonus based on achievement of business and/or individual performance metrics (dependent on position). Benefits offered include Medical, Prescription, Health Savings Account, Flexible Spending Accounts, Dental, Vision, Life, AD&D, Disability, Supplemental Health, Employee Support program, Paid Parental Leave, Pet Insurance, 401(k) and Tuition Reimbursement for your personal development. In addition, teammates may be eligible for up to 10 to 20 days of vacation (depending on tenure), 2 personal days, 5 sick days, 5 volunteer hours, and 6 company holidays (plus Veterans Day for Veterans) annually.

About AIT Worldwide

AIT Worldwide Logistics is a global freight forwarder that helps its customers grow by expanding access to markets all over the world where they can sell and/or procure raw materials, components, and finished goods. For more than 40 years, the America’s-based supply chain solutions leader has relied on a consultative approach to build a global network and trusted partnerships in nearly every industry, including aerospace, automotive, consumer retail, food, government, healthcare, high-tech, industrial and life sciences. Backed by scalable, user-friendly technology, AIT’s flexible business model customizes door-to-door deliveries via sea, air, ground, and rail—on time and on budget. With expert teammates staffing more than 100 worldwide locations in Asia, Europe, India, and North America, AIT’s full-service options also include customs clearance, warehouse management and white glove services. Learn more about AIT Worldwide Logistics, our culture and core values in action here .

AIT Worldwide Logistics is an Equal Opportunity Employer – M/F/Veterans/Disabled. If you are unable to apply online due to a disability, contact Human Resources at 630-766-8300 ext 5218.
